cover_letter:
Dear Hiring Team,

I'm applying for the Python Developer & Tester position at AvePoint. I'm a Software Engineer who builds full-stack platforms powered by AI agents and automation — and I'm looking to bring that mindset to AvePoint.

What sets me apart is how I leverage AI tools to solve real problems. I built ValoFenua, a real estate valuation platform using Python and SQL where a daily automated scraper feeds 1,300+ listings into an AI agent that computes price estimates from live market data. I also designed an automated job search pipeline using n8n workflows, AI agents, and an MCP server — systems where AI drives core functionality, not just assists.

I also automated installation processes at EXAIL, cutting deployment time from ~2 days to ~2 hours (85% reduction) and enabling non-technical staff to perform deployments independently. This automation mindset extends to testing and CI/CD, aligning with your Agile and DevOps practices for quality assurance.

I'm completing my M.S. in Information Systems Engineering (expected 2026) and I'm eager to contribute to securing the future of digital workplaces through robust data management and quality engineering.

Aodren Gloux
aodren.gloux@gmail.com | linkedin.com/in/aodren-gloux | github.com/GAodren

stack: React, Vue, Angular, Node.js, Python, Java, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Git, REST APIs, CI/CD, Cloud
points_positifs: Entry level position perfectly matching 1.5 years professional experience + strong personal projects
Full-stack role requiring React and Node.js, directly aligned with ValoFenua project stack
Singapore location matching candidate's target geography
Opportunity to work on scalable applications with CI/CD and cloud infrastructure exposure
points_negatifs: No explicit mention of visa sponsorship policy in the job description
Company structure (Latin America division hiring for Singapore role) may indicate complex reporting lines
commentaire: Excellent entry-level opportunity for a junior full-stack developer in Singapore, with a tech stack perfectly aligned with Aodren's React/Node.js experience and automation background.
